attributes.action: Britain should offer UK residency to displaced White South Africans.
attributes.additional_details: South Africa is part of the Commonwealth and a former colony of the British Empire. Many White South Africans have family links to the United Kingdom, often they are a hard working and patriotic people, who would be beneficial to Britain, and most importantly they are desperately in need of help. These people are being robbed of all they own, outcast from society, and made to live as second class citizens in appaling conditions in thier home Country. We have a morale obligation to help them.
attributes.background: Many white South Africans have been displaced by a Racially motivated South African Government. The number of these people is set to rise In the near future as White owned farms are to be seized by the Government and given to none white owners. We should accept displaced whites as Refugees here.

rejection.details:
People can already claim asylum if they have left their country and are unable to go back because they fear persecution.

You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/claim-asylum
